Comment: People always yell about Democrats failing at messaging, but everything is always presented through the lens of however Republicans want to frame it here.                It's worth pointing out that this is an Associated Press article, not ABC News, so it's distributed around the country for different local news organizations to run. [Here](https://www.ktsm.com/news/politics/ap-politics/ap-waste-fraud-and-abuse-is-a-political-fight-older-than-the-nation-heres-what-to-know/) is another good example of the kind of article to expect; this one is about doge and waste and fraud in government, which closes with a message about how the government underestimates fraud "even if" Musk's savings aren't as much as promised. It's a pretty typical Bill Barrow article, the AP guy who covers Democrats, and if it seems like it's written for a newspaper in the deep South of the country... it is, because that's his background, and that's essentially why. I wouldn't go so far as to accuse him of outright political bias, but if you ever wondered why your local news station seems like it always has a weird bent to it when it reports on Democrats that sounds like it came from a paper in Alabama or Louisiana, this is likely why.
Author: Oodlydoodley

There is an honest, vehement attempt to downplay who and what she is.   Let me just say, you're right. Folks shouldn't be making knee-jerk reactions. Ask questions first.
